intro: Ptilostemon × tauricola, commonly known as the Tauric hybrid ptilostemon, is a hybrid plant native to the Tauric Chersonese region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-gray hue, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
